alert.note: Alert for Barber; Clark; Comanche; Edwards; Ford; Kiowa; Pratt; Seward; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 06 at 9:51AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kansas and southwest Kansas, including the following counties, in south central Kansas, Barber, Comanche, Edwards, Kiowa and Pratt. In southwest Kansas, Clark, Ford, Grant, Gray, Haskell, Meade, Seward and Stevens. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Recent rains of 1-4 inches along with forecast rainfall amounts in the next two days of potentially 2-4+ inches will lead to flash flooding initially with the heavy rain from the thunderstorms and areal flooding over time after the storms end. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Barber; Clark; Comanche; Edwards; Ford; Kiowa; Pratt; Seward; Stevens
